But the problem is that when companies don’t do that, when all they care is about the bottom line and not what goes into it, ignoring costs that aren’t on their balance sheet, people get hurt. Sometimes their lives are ruined. Sometimes they get sick. Sometimes they get killed.

Those are stakes we can’t lose track of. We need to embrace approaches that can make regulation, compliance, and safety measures more efficient and more streamlined but we need to remember why we have those protections in the first place - because when we don’t, people suffer.

There are countless companies that try to do the right thing, ensuring their products are safe, fixing them when they’re not (instead of just selling them abroad), and making restitution to those they’ve harmed. That’s the moral choice and often the right business choice too.
